description: Shifts left 2 places under Stirling-2 transform.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..150
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210.
maple: stirtr:= proc(p)           proc(n) add(p(k)*combinat[stirling2](n, k), k=0..n) end         end:a:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n<3, 1, aa(n-2)) end:aa:= stirtr(a):seq (a(n), n=1..25);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 22 2012
mathematica: stirtr[p_] := Function[{n}, Sum[p[k]*StirlingS2[n, k], {k, 0, n}]]; a[n_] := a[n] = If[n<3, 1, aa[n-2]]; aa = stirtr[a]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 24}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jan 09 2013, translated from _Alois P. Heinz_'s Maple program *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
